intro: Coussapoa martiana, commonly known as the golden star vine, is a climbing plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble stars. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, smooth seeds. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture. Coussapoa martiana is often found growing along tree trunks and in shaded undergrowth.
